item.title: Solstice Before The Solstice
item.description:
You don’t have to wait for the winter solstice to experience the Samsung Solstice, a touchscreen phone designed for social networking. This sleek phone boasts a vibrant 3-inch color touchscreen with tactile feedback and customizable app widgets for easy access to platforms like Facebook and MySpace. Staying connected is effortless with the Solstice’s virtual keyboard and high-resolution screen, perfect for messaging. Its slim, half-inch profile, achieved through advanced virtual technology, surpasses bulkier models with slide-out keyboards...

item.title: Xperience the Sony Ericsson Xperia X10
item.description:
The Xperia X10 might be the perfect smartphone you’ve been looking for. It boasts an 8.1 Megapixel camera and a 4-inch touchscreen, which begs the question: do you really need to carry a separate camera? The Xperia’s camera eliminates that need with features like flash, 16x zoom, touch focus, geo-tagging, smile detection, and a ‘send to web’ option. It’s adaptable for landscape, portrait, night, beach, and various other settings. You can even edit photos directly on the phone using apps from the Android Market...

item.title: A Plethora of Free Android Phones
item.description:
This Christmas, give the gift of a cutting-edge Android phone without breaking the bank. Although these devices boast advanced technology and typically come with a high price tag (often $500-$600), it’s possible to get one for free. Android smartphones are essentially pocket computers, running on 3G and 4G networks and offering similar functionality to desktops and laptops. They’re capable of web browsing, social networking, email, video streaming, and more. While $500-$600 might be reasonable for such a device, why pay when you can get one for free?..

item.title: BlackBerry Torch Fires Up Mobile Business
item.description:

This smartphone combines a touch screen with a slide-out QWERTY keyboard and introduces the BlackBerry 6 operating system. item.title: Verizon Goes After Blue Collar Cell Phones

However, Verizon is now entering this market, aiming to capture the construction and outdoor enthusiast demographics. item.title: Green Your Cell Phone For St. Patrick's Day
item.description:

item.title: How BlackBerry Touch Screen Technology Works
item.description:
The BlackBerry Storm is a unique addition to the BlackBerry lineup, featuring a touch screen instead of the traditional physical QWERTY keyboard. Though the keyboard is now virtual, it still aims to provide a tactile experience. Why this change? Primarily, to accommodate a larger display screen without increasing the phone’s overall size. To achieve this, the physical keyboard was removed, leaving only essential call, menu, and navigation buttons below the screen...

The HTC-built G1 for T-Mobile might be the solution if you want it all. item.title: BlackBerry 8830 is World Class
item.description:
Verizon Wireless has engineered a BlackBerry that functions domestically and internationally. This is notable because Verizon uses the CDMA network in the US, while the rest of the world primarily uses GSM. Previously, this difference prevented Verizon phones from roaming internationally. To solve this, Verizon created a device with both CDMA and GSM capabilities. In the US, the CDMA component accesses the 800 and 1900 MHz bands, including EV-DO broadband. Outside the US, the GSM component accesses the 900 and 1800 MHz bands, including GPRS broadband...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/blackberry-8830-is-world-class/

item.title: Cell Phone Bill Shock Is So Easy To Avoid
item.description:
The Federal Communications Commission is looking into new regulations due to a high volume of complaints regarding unexpected cell phone charges. While this intervention is welcomed by those who have faced this issue, understanding how to avoid such situations is key. “Bill shock” refers to the unpleasant surprise of discovering unexpectedly high charges on your cell phone bill, often leaving you in disbelief and frantically searching for errors. While billing mistakes can occur, these charges are typically accurate, stemming from a lack of awareness regarding contract details or exceeding usage limits, often unknowingly...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/cell-phone-bill-shock-is-so-easy-to-avoid/

item.title: Recycle Your BlackBerry Phone For Cash
item.description:

Even without a service plan, your old BlackBerry might be worth a significant amount of money depending on its model, age, and condition. Selling it yourself can be a hassle, but there’s an easier way. An electronics recycling company will pay cash for used BlackBerry phones and other cell phone models. To see if yours qualifies, visit their website and search for your BlackBerry model...

item.title: DROID vs DROID
item.description:

The first DROID, manufactured by Motorola for Verizon Wireless, is a touchscreen QWERTY smartphone utilizing the Android 2.0 operating system. This innovative device was recognized as Time.com’s “Top Gadget of 2009”. This top-tier DROID boasts a 5.0-megapixel camera, doubling as a camcorder, with features like geo-tagging, auto-stabilization, flash, and built-in editing tools...

item.title: Your Cell Phone IS Your Business Phone System
item.description:
Why invest in a large, expensive office phone system when you’re an independent professional constantly on the move? If your work revolves around sales or consulting, your mobile phone might be the only phone system you need. It doesn’t make sense for clients to call your office if you’re rarely there. item.description:

Unlike most phones where the keyboard is hidden beneath the screen, the BACKFLIP’s keyboard is located on the exterior, flipping open to reveal a full-size touchscreen. item.title: GoPhones For Hurricane Gustav
item.description:

This act of generosity brought attention to the GoPhone and its potential use as an emergency phone. AT&T’s GoPhone isn’t a specific phone model but a prepaid cellular service. item.title: Democracy In a Cell Phone
item.description:
At this very moment, the American Red Cross has already received $22 million in donations for Haiti earthquake relief through text messages, a number that is expected to climb even higher. This massive demonstration of support is considered groundbreaking, possibly indicating a societal shift rather than a one-time occurrence. The $22 million figure is impressive considering it was accumulated in approximately a week, with each donor contributing $10. This means millions of people acted independently yet almost simultaneously when the call for help was issued...
